definition: Concepts about final destiny of intelligence, society, or world.
opposite_reasoning: EmpiricalConcept provides the strongest semantic opposition to EschatologicalConcept along multiple dimensions: (1) epistemological - faith/revelation vs observation/evidence, (2) temporal - ultimate/final vs present/observable, (3) methodological - prophetic vs scientific. This opposition is particularly useful for AI safety monitoring as it captures the distinction between speculative/unfalsifiable claims vs grounded/testable assertions. While eschatological thinking itself isn't necessarily problematic, the ability to distinguish eschatological reasoning patterns from empirical reasoning is valuable for detecting when AI systems make unfounded predictions about long-term outcomes or invoke pseudo-transcendent justifications. EmpiricalConcept likely exists in SUMO's epistemological framework.
